Some Bibliography of Marion County, Ohio Histories.

"The History of Marion Co., OH."

Chicago; Leggett, Conway, 1883; 1,931pp

"History of Marion Co., OH."

Ed by J. Wilbur Jacoby; Chicago; Pub. Biographical Pub. Co., 1907; 834pp (Reprint Evansville, Ind, Unigraphic 1976)

"Marion Co. 1979 History",

Ed by Treilia H. Romaine. Marion County Hist. Soc., 1979, 848 pp.

"The History of Union Co., OH.",

Containing a 1883 History, 2 Vols; Chicago; W.H. Beers, 1883. 562, 694 pp.

"Memorial Records of the Counties of Delaware, Union & Marrow",

Chicago; Lewis Pub. Co., 1895. 501 pp.

Undergraduate Student of Bibliography, Page County Histories

<--- 1876 History of Page Co., IA. by Elijah MILLER

<--- 1880 History of Page Co., IA. by W.L. KERSHAW.

<--- 1890 Biographical History of Page Co., IA. by IA. Historical Company.

<--- 1909 History of Page Co., IA., Vol. I & II by W.L. KERSHAW.

Illustrated, Volume II, The S.J. CLARKE Publishing Co. REF: 2 Place Mount Ayr Public Library:

"The Monasmith Family History"

A Partial Genealogy of the Families of:

Monesmity-Moneysmith; Monasmith-Monosmith; Monismith-Mannasmith

Self-published, in December 1972, San Jose, California; 131pp.

Compiler: Richard E. Brenneman

Additions -- Corrections -- Supplement:

Nov 1973 ~ pg 80; Apr 1977 ~ pg 104 Mr. Richard E. Brenneman;

Author, Descendant, Researcher P.O. Box 8635, JFK Station, Boston, MA. 02114;

Letter to this writer Apr. 22, 1995.

Richard Brenneman, E-Mail: <--- [email protected]

Date: July 30, 2000 at 10:14:04 1995 Additions -- Corrections -- Supplement's

REF: 8 Person Margurerite Marie (Moneysmith) Orcutt;

1114 W. Roosevelt; Knoxville, IA. 50138;

Dau of Martin C. & Maye (Fisher) Moneysmith.

Letter to this writer 25 Aug. 1986 REF: 9 Person Larry W. MONEYSMITH,

address 500 North Broad, P.O. BOX 68, Shenandoah, Iowa 51601.

Various letters to this writer, 1986 + REF:10 Alice M. (Monasmith) TERRILL (dec'd) Alice Margaret MONASMITH,

(Only Dau of William E. MONASMITH & Mother: Iza Fern ROBBINS)

Lived at: 3032 N. 15th. St. No. 102, Grand Junction, Colorado 81506;

b. 05 Oct 1914, Holmwood, Jewell Co., Kansas

d. 13 Apr 1998, 83yrs, 6mths, & 8 days, Fruita, Mesa Co, Colarado 81521

[SSD# 521-38-9031 CO.]

Buried: Memorial Gardens, Grand Junction, Mesa County, Colorado

<---See: Find A Grave Memorial# 32285619 [Created by: Liz, Dec 19, 2008]

At age 21yrs she married on 27 Apr 1936, Jewell Co., Kansas to:

28 year old Claude Laverne TERRILL,

(1st Son of William Curtis TERRILL & Mother: Maria Elizabeth LATHAM)

b. 24 Jul 1907, Burr Oak City, Jewell Co., Kansas

d. 26 Aug 1958, age 51yrs, 1mth, & 2 days, Grand Junction, Colorado

Buried: Memorial Gardens, Grand Junction, Mesa County, Colorado

<---See: Find A Grave Memorial# 32285623 [Created by: Liz, Dec 19, 2008]

They had 4 Children born to this Union:

President of "Monasmith Association" for many years, Genealogist, Author

Alice wrote various letters to this writer starting 23 Oct. 1989, till her death 1998 a very good friend & she is truley missed!

"The Monasmith Family History"; A Partial Genealogy of the Families of

Monesmity-Moneysmith; Monasmith-Monosmith; Monismith-Mannasmith"

Self-published, in December. 1972, San Jose, CA.; 131pp. By:

Richard E. Brenneman; (See <--- Note Number 7 above.) and Mrs. Alice M. Terrill, (dec'd) Reference Additions/corrections: Pg 84,85; (Pg 26) Nov. 1973

<--- Isaac MANNASMITH, (s/o Peter & 1st Wife Julia A. (Denman) Mannasmith)

E-Mail #001, <--- See: Date: Tue, 22 Jan 2002 1:49:50 PM EST Paul,

My name is Thomas "Wayne" Runyan and I graduated from Amity HS in College Springs, Page Co. IA. Many of my relatives are buried in Page Co. and some still live there.

One of them is Etta Amanda Snyder (d/o Sarah Amanda Runyan) that m. William Andrew Mannasmith.

REF:17 Person Subject: Wm A. "Willy" Mannasmith corrections and additios

From: <--- [email protected]

Date: Sunday, April 19, 2015, At: 10:59 PM

Hi My name is Betty Ann Mannasmith (Robison)

I'm sending corrections as to my Father's family information.

<--- William George Mannasmith. The following information is partially incorrect

15? year old Miss Dorothy "Donna" C. FOREMAN [REF:#7, Pg30]

b. 07 Dec 1929, Page Co., IA. [No SSD#?]

d. 15 Jun 1975, 46yrs, 6mths & 8 days, Shenandoah, IA

Buried: Rose Hill Cemetery, Shenandoah, IA. [CHJ, 19 Jun. 1975]

See: Find A Grave Memorial# 35732166, by: Wayne Runyan, Apr 10, 2009

See: Photo of Find A Grave Monument, [Photo by: Marj Schierkolk, 10/16/2010]

Miss Dorothy "Dottie" May Foreman

Born March 23 1024. She was married at 17.

She still lives in Spokane Washington

My parents had three Children

1. Dau: Shirley May Mannasmith (Buffa) born in Denver Co. 1942 Lives in Vancover Wa.

2. Son: Roger Lee Mannasmith Born November 18,1944 Died August 20 2014 Served in VietNam War U.S. Army

3. Dau: Betty Ann Mannasmith (Robison) Born July 26, 1949 Lives in Spokane Wa

Additional for my immediate family.

I married Joseph Owen Robison August 10 1976

Born June 14,1947 Died Jan. 16, 2011 Served in VietNam U.S.Coast Guard

Children

1. Dau Amy May Robison (Justice) Born Dec. 17, 1977 Two Children Jillian Ann Justice (Father James Robert Justice) Born Sept. 22 2007 Jacob Douglas Morrow (Father Gerald "Jerry" Morrow) Born Feb. 2010

2. Son William K. Robison Born June 14 1979 Children( Twins) Daughter Kendra Josephine Robison Son Kaden James Robison Born May 10, 2004.(Mother Tanya Leann Buster)

REF:18
